column4: Why was the displayconfig-gtk package removed ? I want it badly, what is the alternative ?
not sure there is an alternative - everything is supposed to be detected
there isn't a replacement - 8:10 seems ok for now, but i haven't done many installations of it yet
Its not recognising by default, xorg.conf itself is not showing any details.
ye - the xorg.conf file is supposed to be pretty empty
have you tried sudo dpkg -reconfigure... command you can find in xorg.conf?
I will attempt that and get back to you
yes back to writing everything manually :(
did you read jim_p's comment to use X -configure?
what type of monitor are you having troubles with and what is the trouble?
dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg is not working as it used to be in hardy and previous releases.. It now completes in only 4 steps
what type of monitor are you having troubles with and what is the trouble?
jim_p , I am using Viewsonic 17 inch widescreen with default resolution 1280x720
flatscreen or one of the old crt's?
flatscreen LCD, the problem is the horizontal and vertical syncs are not being detected automatically
run through the page at http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=269052&highlight=1280 and see if that helps
I'm planning to run hardy live cd and make a backup of the xorg.conf there and pasting it back here, instead doing all those manual stuff, Would that work ?
jim_p, Thanks for your time, booting hardy
